## Description

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 12 x 1.5 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 12 x 1.5

Length: 22 mm

External Thread: M 16 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## BaerFix with cutting slots M 12 x 1,5 - 22 mm

From **$21.00** ~~~~

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 12 x 1.5 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 12 x 1.5

Length: 22 mm

External Thread: M 16 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

Size

- 5
- 100

[View product](https://www.jgengineering.ie/products/baerfix-with-cutting-slots-m-12-x-1-5-22-mm)

## Description

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 12 x 1.75 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 12 x 1.75

Length: 22 mm

External Thread: M 16 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated, conform to RoHS

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

_**No one in Ireland stocks the size range we do. Whether you need a pack of 2 or a box of 2,000 we've got you covered.**_

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## BaerFix with cutting slots M 14 x 1,5 - 24 mm

**$24.00** ~~~~

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 14 x 1.5 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 14 x 1.5

Length: 24 mm

External Thread: M 18 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

[View product](https://www.jgengineering.ie/products/baerfix-with-cutting-slots-m-14-x-1-5-24-mm)

## Delivery and Shipping

**Shipping Information**

BaerFix with cutting slots M 14 x 2,0 - 24 mm

## Description

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 14 x 2.0 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 14 x 2.0

Length: 24 mm

External Thread: M 18 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated, conform to RoHS

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

_**No one in Ireland stocks the size range we do. Whether you need a pack of 2 or a box of 2,000 we've got you covered.**_

![](https://www.jgengineering.ie/cdn/shop/files/DULUX_PAINT.jpg?v=1753876614&width=1200)

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## BaerFix with cutting slots M 16 x 2,0 - 22 mm

From **$19.00** ~~~~

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 16 x 2.0 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 16 x 2.0

Length: 22 mm

External Thread: M 20 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated, conform to RoHS

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

Size

- 5
- 50

## Description

BaerFix self-tapping Thread Inserts M 18 x 2.5 with cutting slots

Internal Thread: M 18 x 2.5

Length: 24 mm

External Thread: M 22 x 1.5

Material: Case-hardened Steel, zinc-plated

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

_**No one in Ireland stocks the size range we do. Whether you need a pack of 2 or a box of 2,000 we've got you covered.**_

![](https://www.jgengineering.ie/cdn/shop/files/DULUX_PAINT.jpg?v=1753876614&width=1200)

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

BaerFix:

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

\- Thread Repair of damaged or worn-out threads

\- Recovery of rejected items

\- Thread Armour Plating. For material with low shear

strenght eg. aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys.

[BaerFix Dimensions](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_dimensions.html)

[BaerFix Materials and Surface Treatments](http://www.baercoil.com/en/baerfix_materials.html)

[BaerFix Technical Information](http://www.baercoil.com/en/bf_technical_info.html)

[Instruction for use (Thread Repair)](http://www.baercoil.com/en/instructions_baerfix.html)

With BaerFix the new thread is stronger than the original one.

When used in light alloys, for example, a degree of pull-out strength is achieved which far exceeds the yield strength of a screw 8.8.

Use in machine-building, electrical, automotive, medical and aerospace industries.

_Important:_ Suitable for following materials: Aluminium, light alloys, NF metals,

brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminated plastic and hardwood.

For strong, hard and tough materials it is recommended to tap the thread (max. intermediate tap)

before the installation of BaerFix inserts.

We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 10 x 1.5 - ECO

With the BaerFix® thread repair set, damaged M 10 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 10 |
| Pitch | 1,5 |
| Dimension | M 10 x 1,5 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 40 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 18.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 22.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 12.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 13.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 13.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 13.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 13.2 - 13.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 12.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 13.0 - 13.2 mm |

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 10 x 1,5 |
| D2 | M 14 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 18 mm |
| Diameter | 10 |

### Content

- 1 x 1-111132: BaerFix HSS twist drill bit with countersunk shank 13.25 mm
- 1 x 1-KEBW10: BaerFix Installation tool M 10
- 1 x B9501: BaerFix adapter nut
- 5 x FE10: BaerFix self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots M 10 x 1.5 - length: 18 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 2.80 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 4.20 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 3.50 mm |

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 10 x 1.5 - ECO

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. ## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 5 x 0.8 - ECO

With the BaerFix® thread repair set, damaged M 5 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 5 |
| Pitch | 0,8 |
| Dimension | M 5 x 0,8 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 10 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 400-600 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 10.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 13.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 7.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 7.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 7.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 7.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 7.5 - 7.6 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 7.2 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 7.3 - 7.5 mm |

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 5 x 0,8 |
| D2 | M 8 x 1,0 |
| L1 | 10 mm |
| Diameter | 5 |

### Content

- 1 x 1-16175: BaerFix HSS twist drill bit 7.50 mm
- 1 x 1-KEBW05: BaerFix Installation tool M 5
- 1 x B9501: BaerFix adapter nut
- 5 x FE05: BaerFix self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots M 5 x 0.8 - length: 10 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 1.60 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 2.40 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 2.00 mm |

###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 6 x 1.0 - ECO

With the BaerFix® thread repair set, damaged M 6 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 14.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 17.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 8.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 9.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 9.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 9.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 9.2 - 9.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 8.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 9.0 - 9.2 mm |

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D2 | M 10 x 1,5 |

BAERCOIL


## M6 X 1.0 BAERFIX KIT ECO - FOO6

**$47.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 6 x 1.0 - ECO

With the BaerFix® thread repair set, damaged M 6 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 14.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 17.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 8.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 9.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 9.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 9.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 9.2 - 9.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 8.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 9.0 - 9.2 mm |

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 6 x 1,0 |
| D2 | M 10 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 14 mm |
| Diameter | 6 |

### Content

- 1 x 1-16193: BaerFix HSS twist drill bit 9.30 mm
- 1 x 1-KEBW06: BaerFix Installation tool M 6
- 1 x B9501: BaerFix adapter nut
- 5 x FE06: BaerFix self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots M 6 x 1.0 - length: 14 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

| materials |
| --- |

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 4 x 0.7 - 8 mm - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 4 |
| Pitch | 0,7 |
| Dimension | M 4 x 0,7 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 5,5 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 400-600 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 5.9 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 6.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 6.1 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 6.2 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 6.1 - 6.2 mm<br>Cast iron ( **Brinel hardness below 150 HB** ): 5.9 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 6.0 - 6.1 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ) **:** 6.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 4 x 0,7 |
| D2 | M 6,5 x 0,75 |
| L1 | 8 mm |
| Diameter | 4 |

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 4 x 0.7 - 8 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 4 |
| Pitch | 0,7 |
| Dimension | M 4 x 0,7 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 5,5 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 400-600 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 5.9 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 6.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 6.1 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 6.2 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 6.1 - 6.2 mm<br>Cast iron ( **Brinel hardness below 150 HB** ): 5.9 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 6.0 - 6.1 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ) **:** 6.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 4 x 0,7 |
| D2 | M 6,5 x 0,75 |
| L1 | 8 mm |
| Diameter | 4 |

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 1.30 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 1.95 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 1.63 mm |

###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 4 x 0.7 - 8 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 6 x 1.0 - 12 mm - thin-walled - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 12.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 15.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 8.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 8.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 8.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 8.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 8.5 - 8.6 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 8.2 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 8.3 - 8.5 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

| D2 | M 9 x 1,0 |
| L1 | 12 mm |
| Diameter | 6 |

BAERCOIL


## M6 X 1 BAERFIX ST ST INSERTS PACK OF 100

**$168.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 6 x 1.0 - 12 mm - thin-walled - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 12.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 15.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 8.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 8.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 8.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 8.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 8.5 - 8.6 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 8.2 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 8.3 - 8.5 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 6 x 1,0 |
| D2 | M 9 x 1,0 |
| L1 | 12 mm |
| Diameter | 6 |

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 1.80 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 2.70 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 2.25 mm |

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 8 x 1.25 - 15 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 8 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | M 8 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 28 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 10.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 11.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 11.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 11.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 11.2 - 11.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 10.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 11.0 - 11.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

| D2 | M 12 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 15 mm |

## Size Matters!

_**No one in Ireland stocks the size range we do. Whether you need a pack of 2 or a box of 2,000 we've got you covered.**_

![](https://www.jgengineering.ie/cdn/shop/files/DULUX_PAINT.jpg?v=1753876614&width=1200)

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

BAERCOIL


## M8 X 1.25 BAERFIX ST ST INSERTS PACK OF 100

**$225.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 8 x 1.25 - 15 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 8 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | M 8 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 28 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 10.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 11.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 11.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 11.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 11.2 - 11.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 10.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 11.0 - 11.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 8 x 1,25 |
| D2 | M 12 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 15 mm |
| Diameter | 8 |

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 2.40 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 3.60 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 3.00 mm |

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 6 x 1.0 - 14 mm - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 14.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 17.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 8.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 9.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 9.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 9.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 9.2 - 9.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 8.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 9.0 - 9.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

![](https://www.jgengineering.ie/cdn/shop/files/DULUX_PAINT.jpg?v=1753876614&width=1200)

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## 1-FE06 - M6 BAERFIX INSERTS 100Pck

**$75.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 6 x 1.0 - 14 mm - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 5 x 0.8 - 10 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 5 |
| Pitch | 0,8 |
| Dimension | M 5 x 0,8 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 10 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 400-600 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 10.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 13.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 7.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 7.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 7.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 7.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 7.5 - 7.6 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 7.2 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 7.3 - 7.5 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

| D2 | M 8 x 1,0 |
| L1 | 10 mm |
| Diameter | 5 |

###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 5 x 0.8 - 10 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

**$156.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 5 x 0.8 - 10 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 5 |
| Pitch | 0,8 |
| Dimension | M 5 x 0,8 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 10 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 400-600 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 10.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 13.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 7.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 7.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 7.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 7.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 7.5 - 7.6 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness below 150 HB):** 7.2 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 7.3 - 7.5 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 8 x 1.25 - 15 mm - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 8 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | M 8 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 28 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 10.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 11.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 11.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 11.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 11.2 - 11.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 10.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 11.0 - 11.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

BAERCOIL


## 1-FE08 - M8 X 1.25 BAERFIX INSERTS - 100Pck

**$96.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 8 x 1.25 - 15 mm - 100 pcs.

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 8 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | M 8 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 28 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 10.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 11.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 11.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 11.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 11.2 - 11.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 10.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 11.0 - 11.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 8 x 1,25 |
| D2 | M 12 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 15 mm |
| Diameter | 8 |

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 2.40 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 3.60 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 3.00 mm |
