## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting holes M 8 x 1.25 - 9 mm - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three tapping holes are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for materials that are difficult to machine. These inserts have a thicker wall and can therefore absorb more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes. They are also the right choice if you do not need a screw locking effect. If a clamping effect is desired, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 8 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | M 8 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 28 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 9.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 11.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 11.1 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 11.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 11.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 11.5 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 11.3 - 11.5 mm<br>Cast iron ( **Brinel hardness below 150 HB)**: 11.1 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 11.2 - 11.3 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ): 11.5 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

| D2 | M 12 x 1,5 |

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Spark Plug Thread Repair Kit M 10 x 1.0

* * *

With the BaerFix® spark plug thread repair set, damaged MF 10 x 1.0 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, in addition to the thread inserts, the set includes a core drill bit, a taper countersink and an assembly tool. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 10 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | MF 10 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 40 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 12.4 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 10 x 1,0 |
| D2 | Special threads |
| L1 | 8mm & 13mm |
| Diameter | 10 |

### Content

- 1 x 161124: BaerCoil HSS twist drill bit 12.40 mm
- 1 x ZEBW10: BaerFix Installation tool for spark plug thread M 10 x 1.0
- 2 x FE101008: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 10 x 1.0 - length: 8 mm - material: case hardened steel, zinc plated
- 2 x FE101013: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 10 x 1.0 - length: 13 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

Product information

## BaerFix Spark Plug Thread Repair Kit M 10 x 1.0

* * *

With the BaerFix® spark plug thread repair set, damaged MF 10 x 1.0 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, in addition to the thread inserts, the set includes a core drill bit, a taper countersink and an assembly tool. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 10 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | MF 10 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 40 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 12.4 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 10 x 1,0 |
| D2 | Special threads |
| L1 | 8mm & 13mm |
| Diameter | 10 |

- 1 x 161124: BaerCoil HSS twist drill bit 12.40 mm

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Spark Plug Thread Repair Kit M 14 x 1.25

* * *

With the BaerFix® spark plug thread repair set, damaged MF 14 x 1.25 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, in addition to the thread inserts, the set includes a core drill bit, a taper countersink and an assembly tool. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 14 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | MF 14 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 100 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 17.0 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 14 x 1,25 |
| D2 | M 17,7 x 1,25 |
| L1 | 9mm & 15mm |
| Diameter | 14 |

### Content

- 1 x 111170: BaerCoil HSS twist drill bit with countersunk shank 17.00 mm
- 1 x ZEBW14: BaerFix Installation tool for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25
- 2 x FE141251: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25 - length: 15 mm - material: case hardened steel, zinc plated
- 2 x FE141259: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25 - length: 9 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

BAERCOIL


## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit for Spark Plug M 14 x 1,25 (F14125)

**$127.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Spark Plug Thread Repair Kit M 14 x 1.25

* * *

With the BaerFix® spark plug thread repair set, damaged MF 14 x 1.25 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, in addition to the thread inserts, the set includes a core drill bit, a taper countersink and an assembly tool. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 14 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | MF 14 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 100 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 15.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 18.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 17.0 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 14 x 1,25 |
| D2 | M 17,7 x 1,25 |
| L1 | 9mm & 15mm |
| Diameter | 14 |

### Content

- 1 x 111170: BaerCoil HSS twist drill bit with countersunk shank 17.00 mm
- 1 x ZEBW14: BaerFix Installation tool for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25
- 2 x FE141251: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25 - length: 15 mm - material: case hardened steel, zinc plated
- 2 x FE141259: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 14 x 1.25 - length: 9 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

[View product](https://www.jgengineering.ie/products/baerfixthreadrepairkitforsparkplugm14x125f14125)

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts for spark plugss M 10 x 1.0 - 13 mm - 5 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three cutting holes are self-tapping guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your spark plug thread or glow plug thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection with the spark plug or glow plug is no longer possible. This is where the self-tapping BaerFix® thread insert comes into play. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen the existing thread. If the thread in your cylinder head is damaged, this does not have to be a scrap. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded with higher pull-out strength at the same time and also becomes more wear-resistant. The thread inserts are designed so that the sealing ring of the spark plug protrudes beyond the thread insert.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with tapping holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for light and difficult-to-machine materials. These inserts can take more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 10 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | MF 10 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 40 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 13.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 16.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 12.4 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Repair of spark plug threads and glow plug threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the receiving material
- very high pull-out strength
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 10 x 1,0 |
| D2 | Special threads |
| L1 | 13 mm |
| Diameter | 10 |

###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts for spark plugss M 14 x 1.25 - 9 mm - 5 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three cutting holes are self-tapping guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your spark plug thread or glow plug thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection with the spark plug or glow plug is no longer possible. This is where the self-tapping BaerFix® thread insert comes into play. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen the existing thread. If the thread in your cylinder head is damaged, this does not have to be a scrap. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded with higher pull-out strength at the same time and also becomes more wear-resistant. The thread inserts are designed so that the sealing ring of the spark plug protrudes beyond the thread insert.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with tapping holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for light and difficult-to-machine materials. These inserts can take more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 14 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | MF 14 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 100 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 9.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 11.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 17.0 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Repair of spark plug threads and glow plug threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the receiving material
- very high pull-out strength
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 14 x 1,25 |
| D2 | M 17,7 x 1,25 |
| L1 | 9 mm |
| Diameter | 14 |

## BaerFix Thread Inserts for spark plugss M 14 x 1.25 - 9 mm - 5 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three cutting holes are self-tapping guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

This is where the self-tapping BaerFix® thread insert comes into play. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen the existing thread. ## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Repair Kit M 12 x 1.5 - ECO

* * *

With the BaerFix® thread repair set, damaged MF 12 x 1.5 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 12 |
| Pitch | 1,5 |
| Dimension | MF 12 x 1,5 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 60 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 22.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 26.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 14.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 15.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 15.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 15.2 - 15.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 14.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 15.0 - 15.2 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting slots](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | MF 12 x 1,5 |
| D2 | M 16 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 22 mm |
| Diameter | 12 |

### Content

- 1 x 1-111152: BaerFix HSS twist drill bit with countersunk shank 15.25 mm
- 1 x 1-KEBW1215: BaerFix Installation tool M 12 x 1.5
- 1 x B9501: BaerFix adapter nut
- 5 x FE125: BaerFix self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots M 12 x 1.5 - length: 22 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

### Minimum wall thickness

![](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/c9/g0/bd/Zeichnung_Restwandstaerke.svg)

| materials |
| --- |
| Rmin (light metal): 3.20 mm<br>Rmin (cast iron): 4.80 mm<br>Rmin (plastic): 4.00 mm |

Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, the set includes a core drill bit and an assembly tool in addition to the thread inserts. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 12 |
| Pitch | 1,5 |
| Dimension | MF 12 x 1,5 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 60 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 22.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 26.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 14.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 15.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 15.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 15.2 - 15.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 14.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 15.0 - 15.2 mm |

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 10 x 1.5 - 18 mm - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 10 |
| Pitch | 1,5 |
| Dimension | M 10 x 1,5 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 40 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 18.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 22.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 12.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 13.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 13.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 13.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 13.2 - 13.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 12.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 13.0 - 13.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting slots](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D1 | M 10 x 1,5 |
| D2 | M 14 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 18 mm |
| Diameter | 10 |

We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

1-FAL12 M12 x 1.75 x 12mm STST BaerFix® Inserts

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting holes M 12 x 1.75 - 12 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three tapping holes are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for materials that are difficult to machine. These inserts have a thicker wall and can therefore absorb more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes. They are also the right choice if you do not need a screw locking effect. If a clamping effect is desired, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 12 |
| Pitch | 1,75 |
| Dimension | M 12 x 1,75 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 60 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 12.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 15.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 15.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 15.1 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 15.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 - 15.4 mm<br>Cast iron (Brinel **hardness below 150 HB)**: 15.0 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 15.1 - 15.2 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ): 15.4 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

| D1 | M 12 x 1,75 |
| D2 | M 16 x 1,75 |
| L1 | 12 mm |

BAERCOIL


## 1-FAL12 M12 x 1.75 x 12mm STST BaerFix® Inserts

**$424.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting holes M 12 x 1.75 - 12 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three tapping holes are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for materials that are difficult to machine. These inserts have a thicker wall and can therefore absorb more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes. They are also the right choice if you do not need a screw locking effect. If a clamping effect is desired, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 12 |
| Pitch | 1,75 |
| Dimension | M 12 x 1,75 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 60 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 12.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 15.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 15.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 15.1 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 15.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 15.2 - 15.4 mm<br>Cast iron (Brinel **hardness below 150 HB)**: 15.0 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 15.1 - 15.2 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ): 15.4 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

| D2 | M 16 x 1,75 |

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 14 x 2.0 - 24 mm - 50 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 14 |
| Pitch | 2,0 |
| Dimension | M 14 x 2,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 100 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 24.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 28.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 16.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 17.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 17.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 17.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 17.2 - 17.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 16.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 17.0 - 17.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting slots](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/2e/e9/e7/BaerFix_Schlitz.svg)

| D2 | M 18 x 1,5 |
| L1 | 24 mm |
| Diameter | 14 |

## M14 x 2.0 - 24 mm - BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots 50 pcs.

**$126.00** ~~~~

Product information

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting slots M 14 x 2.0 - 24 mm - 50 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

Thanks to the cutting slot, the thread inserts remain anchored in the workpiece even in the event of strong shocks or vibrations. The cutting slots can spring slightly inwards, so that there is an additional clamping effect for the screw. In many applications, this is advantageous for the design. If this effect is undesirable, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 14 |
| Pitch | 2,0 |
| Dimension | M 14 x 2,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting slots |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting slots |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 100 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 150-200 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 24.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 28.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 16.8 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 17.0 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 17.2 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²):** 17.4 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength over 350 N/mm²** ): 17.2 - 17.4 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel** **hardness under 150 HB):** 16.8 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB)**: 17.0 - 17.2 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

## Description

Product information

## BaerFix Spark Plug Thread Repair Kit M 12 x 1.25

* * *

With the BaerFix® spark plug thread repair set, damaged MF 12 x 1.25 threads can be repaired quickly and easily.

This set contains all the tools you need to achieve a permanent and strong anchorage in various materials. The BaerFix® thread repair set is ideal for materials such as aluminium, light metals, non-ferrous metals, brass, bronze, cast iron, plastics, laminates and hardwood. Please note that the set is only suitable for materials with a tensile strength up to approx. 450 N/mm².

BaerFix® thread inserts are self-tapping, guarantee a permanently tight threaded connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to use. Simply screw into the hole - the inserts cut the holding thread themselves. Once your thread is worn or torn out, a stable connection between the materials is no longer possible. This is where BaerFix® thread insert comes to the rescue. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair or strengthen damaged internal thread. Damaged threads in your components do not have to be rejects. Simply insert a threaded insert with the same internal thread into the component and your thread will not only be repaired, it will also be more pull-out resistant and wear resistant. The pull-out strength is higher than a class 8.8 screw.

To assist with the repair, in addition to the thread inserts, the set includes a core drill bit, a taper countersink and an assembly tool. Use the core drill bit to prepare the core hole and the installation tool to insert the self-tapping thread insert.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 12 |
| Pitch | 1,25 |
| Dimension | MF 12 x 1,25 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts - Thread repair kits |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix thread repair kits |
| Thread standard | MF: Metric ISO fine thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Case-hardened steel, galvanized |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 60 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 200-300 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 10.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 13.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | 14.5 mm |

### Technical drawing

![Technical drawing BaerFix thread insert with cutting holes](https://media.baer.tools/media/vector/7f/ab/b1/BaerFix_Loch.svg)

| D1 | MF 12 x 1,25 |
| D2 | Special threads |
| L1 | 10mm & 14mm |
| Diameter | 12 |

### Content

- 1 x 111144: BaerCoil HSS twist drill bit with countersunk shank 14.40 mm
- 1 x ZEBW12: BaerFix Installation tool for spark plug thread M 12 x 1.25
- 2 x FE1210: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 12 x 1.25 - length: 10 mm - material: case hardened steel, zinc plated
- 2 x FE121214: BaerFix thread insert for spark plug thread M 12 x 1.25 - length: 14 mm - material: case-hardened steel, galvanised

M6 X 1.0 BAERFIX CUTTING HOLE STST (1-FAL06)

## Description

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting holes M 6 x 1.0 - 8 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three tapping holes are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for materials that are difficult to machine. These inserts have a thicker wall and can therefore absorb more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes. They are also the right choice if you do not need a screw locking effect. If a clamping effect is desired, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 9.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 9.4 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 9.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 9.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 9.5 - 9.6 mm<br>Cast iron ( **Brinel hardness below 150 HB** ): 9.3 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 9.4 - 9.5 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ) **:** 9.6 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry

### Technical drawing

View details


###### Circlips

We stock a comprehensive range of internal and external circlips, available in both carbon steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 2mm to 280mm, ensuring solutions for a wide variety of applications.

View details


###### Roll Pins

When it comes to roll pins, our range is second to none. We stock diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths available for each size. All pins are available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, ensuring durability and performance for any application.

View details


###### Cotter pins

We stock an extensive range of cotter pins in both standard steel and stainless steel. Sizes range from 1.5mm to 20mm in diameter, with 16 different lengths available in each diameter.

View details


###### Spirol Pins

Our selection of spirol pins, featuring a unique Swiss-roll design for enhanced strength and flexibility, is unmatched. We offer diameters from 1.5mm to 30mm, with up to 16 different lengths per size. Available in both spring carbon steel and stainless steel, they’re ideal for high-performance fastening applications.

# **Discover why Professionals Prefer BaerCoil over all other Thread Repair Kits**

Your cart is empty

![](https://www.jgengineering.ie/products/m6x10baerfixcuttingholestst1-fal06)

BAERCOIL


## M6 X 1.0 BAERFIX CUTTING HOLE STST (1-FAL06)

**$259.00** ~~~~

## BaerFix Thread Inserts with cutting holes M 6 x 1.0 - 8 mm - 1.4305 - 100 pcs.

* * *

BaerFix® thread inserts with three tapping holes are self-tapping and guarantee a permanent fixed thread connection in your workpiece and are extremely easy to handle. Simply screw them into the hole - you cut the holding thread yourself.

If your thread is worn or torn out, a stable material connection is no longer possible. This is where the BaerFix® self-tapping thread insert comes in. With our self-tapping thread inserts you can repair your broken internal thread or strengthen an existing thread. If there are damaged threads in your components, this does not have to be a waste. Simply insert a threaded bush with the same internal thread into the component, so that your thread is not only repaired, but can also be loaded at the same time with higher pull-out strength and is also more wear-resistant.

With BaerFix® thread inserts you need fewer connecting parts, reduce the screw dimensions to be used, save material and space - and all this with low weight and high requirements. For many products, saving weight is an important factor.

The BaerFix® self-tapping thread inserts with cutting holes are ideal when you want to create a strong connection for materials that are difficult to machine. These inserts have a thicker wall and can therefore absorb more force, which is also distributed over three cutting holes. They are also the right choice if you do not need a screw locking effect. If a clamping effect is desired, we recommend our self-tapping thread inserts with cutting slots.

### Dimensions

| Diameter | 6 |
| Pitch | 1,0 |
| Dimension | M 6 x 1,0 |

### Characteristics

| Product group | Self-cutting thread inserts |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Product type | BaerFix self-cutting inserts with cutting holes |
| Thread standard | M: Metric ISO standard thread according to DIN 13 |
| Tolerance | ISO2/6H |
| Direction | Right |
| Type | with cutting holes |
| Material | Stainless Steel 1.4305 (AISI 303) |

### Guidelines for material machining

| Maximum insertion torque | 15 Nm |
| Speed guide value for light metals | 280-400 R/min |
| Drilling depth | Min. drilling depth for through hole: 8.00 mm<br>Min. drilling depth for blind hole: 10.00 mm |
| Pre-drilling diameter | **Light metal alloys (tensile strength below 250 N/mm²):** 9.3 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 250 - 300 N/mm²):** 9.4 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength 300 - 350 N/mm²):** 9.5 mm<br>**Light metal alloys (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 9.6 mm<br>**Brass, non-ferrous metals, bronze (tensile strength above 350 N/mm²):** 9.5 - 9.6 mm<br>Cast iron ( **Brinel hardness below 150 HB** ): 9.3 mm<br>Cast iron **(Brinel hardness 150 - 200 HB):** 9.4 - 9.5 mm<br>**Cast iron (Brinel hardness above 200 HB** ) **:** 9.6 mm |

### Attributes

- Thread repair damaged or worn threads
- Scrap recovery
- Thread armoring of materials with low shear strength such as aluminium and magnesium alloys, wood, PVC, etc
- For example, in an application in light metal, a pull-out strength can be achieved that is higher than the yield strength of an 8.8 screw.
- Cutting the holding thread itself during screwing in
- high compression with the holding material
- very high pull-out strength
- minimises space and weight
- high corrosion resistance
- easy to use
- Areas of application in the entire metal and plastics processing industry
